alert.note: Alert for East Polk; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 7:09PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cherokee, western Clay, Polk and southern Monroe Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 809 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Ducktown, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Andrews, Murphy, Benton, Ducktown, Hayesville, William L. Davenport Refuge, Big Frog Mountain, Parksville, Copperhill and Bullet Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: East Polk; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe; West Polk
